greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Total number of factors over all ordered factorizations of n.
comment: What is the limit log(Sum_{k=1..n} a(k)) / log(n) ?. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 03 2019
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Vaclav Kotesovec, Graph log(Sum_{k=1..n} a(k)) / log(n), 10^8 terms
example: a(20)=18 because in the ordered factorizations of twenty: 20, 2*10, 4*5, 5*4, 10*2, 2*2*5, 2*5*2, 5*2*2 there are a total of 18 factors.
maple: a:= n-> (p-> add(coeff(p, x, i)*i, i=1..degree(p)))(b(n)):
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 01 2015
